page.title: 16Rolvenden' Countryside
page.content: There is variety of landscape in the area, with small wooded valleys, open parkland, the wide flat valleys of the drained River Rother estuary and the gently-sloping fields of pasture or arable farming. There are 145 small ponds in the area, scattered so that every other field seems to have a pond or two in it. These differing habitats mean that different wildlife can be seen. Mr A. Lloyd, the author who has lived at Lambsland Farm for 18 years, regularly watches weasels and other small mammals scurrying about his garden. Otters no longer hunt in Otter Channel, but wild mink are becoming more common. Angling, ferreting and other country sports are popular pastimes but some changes in farming methods may be affecting the natural environment.
